newsitem.title: GERMANY: German jobs problem needs joint effort - union chief.
newsitem.headline: German jobs problem needs joint effort - union chief.

text.p: The German government should join forces with trade unions and fight together to tackle the country's mass unemployment, a leading German employers union said on Tuesday.

Dieter Hundt, President of the German Employers Federation, who will speak at unions' summit meeting in Berlin on Tuesday, called on the government to lower employers' social security contributions, as it had pledged to do 14 months ago.
"These promises have not been fulfilled in the last 14 months," Hundt told German radio, adding that social security costs had actually risen, rather than been reduced.
Hundt said that only with combined efforts would a lasting reduction in unemployment be possible.
